    • Constructor Detail

      • ParticleSystem

        public ParticleSystem(ViewGroup parentView,
                      int maxParticles,
                      Drawable drawable,
                      long timeToLive)
        Creates a particle system with the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        parentView - The parent view group.
        drawable - The drawable to use as a particle.
        maxParticles - The maximum number of particles.
        timeToLive - The time to live for the particles.

      • ParticleSystem

        public ParticleSystem(Activity a,
                      int maxParticles,
                      int drawableRedId,
                      long timeToLive)
        Creates a particle system with the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        a - The parent activity.
        maxParticles - The maximum number of particles.
        drawableRedId - The drawable resource to use as particle (supports Bitmaps and Animations).
        timeToLive - The time to live for the particles.

      • ParticleSystem

        public ParticleSystem(Activity a,
                      int maxParticles,
                      int drawableRedId,
                      long timeToLive,
                      int parentViewId)
        Creates a particle system with the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        a - The parent activity.
        maxParticles - The maximum number of particles.
        drawableRedId - The drawable resource to use as particle (supports Bitmaps and Animations).
        timeToLive - The time to live for the particles.
        parentViewId - The view Id for the parent of the particle system.

    • Method Detail

      • dpToPx

        public float dpToPx(float dp)

      • setFPS

        public static void setFPS(double fps)
        Sets the frames per second of ALL ParticleSystems.
        Parameters:
        fps - The desired frames per second.

      • addModifier

        public ParticleSystem addModifier(ParticleModifier modifier)
        Adds a modifier to the Particle system, it will be executed on each update.
        Parameters:
        modifier - Modifier to be added to the ParticleSystem.
        Returns:
        This.

      • setSpeedRange

        public ParticleSystem setSpeedRange(float speedMin,
                                    float speedMax)
        Initializes the speed range of emitted particles. Uses 0 − 360 as the angle range.
        Parameters:
        speedMin - The minimum speed to emit particles.
        speedMax - The maximum speed to emit particles.
        Returns:
        This.
        See Also:
        setSpeedModuleAndAngleRange(float, float, int, int)

      • setSpeedModuleAndAngleRange

        public ParticleSystem setSpeedModuleAndAngleRange(float speedMin,
                                                  float speedMax,
                                                  int minAngle,
                                                  int maxAngle)
        Initializes the speed range and angle range of emitted particles. Angles are in degrees and non negative: 0 meaning to the right, 90 to the bottom,... in clockwise orientation. Speed is non negative and is described in pixels per millisecond.
        Parameters:
        speedMin - The minimum speed to emit particles.
        speedMax - The maximum speed to emit particles.
        minAngle - The minimum angle to emit particles in degrees.
        maxAngle - The maximum angle to emit particles in degrees.
        Returns:
        This.

      • setSpeedByComponentsRange

        public ParticleSystem setSpeedByComponentsRange(float speedMinX,
                                                float speedMaxX,
                                                float speedMinY,
                                                float speedMaxY)
        Initializes the speed components ranges that particles will be emitted. Speeds are measured in density pixels per millisecond.
        Parameters:
        speedMinX - The minimum speed in x direction.
        speedMaxX - The maximum speed in x direction.
        speedMinY - The minimum speed in y direction.
        speedMaxY - The maximum speed in y direction.
        Returns:
        This.

      • setInitialRotationRange

        public ParticleSystem setInitialRotationRange(int minAngle,
                                              int maxAngle)
        Initializes the initial rotation range of emitted particles. The rotation angle is measured in degrees with 0° being no rotation at all and 90° tilting the image to the right.
        Parameters:
        minAngle - The minimum tilt angle.
        maxAngle - The maximum tilt angle.
        Returns:
        This.

      • setScaleRange

        public ParticleSystem setScaleRange(float minScale,
                                    float maxScale)
        Initializes the scale range of emitted particles. Will scale the images around their center multiplied with the given scaling factor.
        Parameters:
        minScale - The minimum scaling factor
        maxScale - The maximum scaling factor.
        Returns:
        This.

      • setRotationSpeed

        public ParticleSystem setRotationSpeed(float rotationSpeed)
        Initializes the rotation speed of emitted particles. Rotation speed is measured in degrees per second.
        Parameters:
        rotationSpeed - The rotation speed.
        Returns:
        This.

      • setRotationSpeedRange

        public ParticleSystem setRotationSpeedRange(float minRotationSpeed,
                                            float maxRotationSpeed)
        Initializes the rotation speed range for emitted particles. The rotation speed is measured in degrees per second and can be positive or negative.
        Parameters:
        minRotationSpeed - The minimum rotation speed.
        maxRotationSpeed - The maximum rotation speed.
        Returns:
        This.

      • setAccelerationModuleAndAndAngleRange

        public ParticleSystem setAccelerationModuleAndAndAngleRange(float minAcceleration,
                                                            float maxAcceleration,
                                                            int minAngle,
                                                            int maxAngle)
        Initializes the acceleration range and angle range of emitted particles. The acceleration components in x and y direction are controlled by the acceleration angle. The acceleration is measured in density pixels (dp) per square millisecond. The angle is measured in degrees with 0° pointing to the right and going clockwise.
        Parameters:
        minAcceleration - The minimum acceleration of emitted particles.
        maxAcceleration - The maximum acceleration of emitted particles.
        minAngle - The minimum acceleration angle.
        maxAngle - The maximum acceleration angle.
        Returns:
        This.

      • addInitializer

        public ParticleSystem addInitializer(ParticleInitializer initializer)
        Adds a custom initializer for emitted particles. The most common use case is the ability to update the initializer in real-time instead of adding new ones ontop of the existing one.
        Parameters:
        initializer - The non-null initializer to add.
        Returns:
        This.

      • setAcceleration

        public ParticleSystem setAcceleration(float acceleration,
                                      int angle)
        Initializes the acceleration for emitted particles with the given angle. Acceleration is measured in pixels per square millisecond. The angle is measured in degrees with 0° meaning to the right and orientation being clockwise. The angle controls the acceleration direction.
        Parameters:
        acceleration - The acceleration.
        angle - The acceleration direction.
        Returns:
        This.

      • setParentViewGroup

        public ParticleSystem setParentViewGroup(ViewGroup viewGroup)
        Initializes the parent view group. This needs to be done before any other configuration or emitting is done. Drawing will be done to a child that is added to this view. So this view needs to allow displaying an arbitrary sized view on top of its other content.
        Parameters:
        viewGroup - The view group to use.
        Returns:
        This.

      • setStartTime

        public ParticleSystem setStartTime(long time)
        Configures a starting time for the particle system to start the particle system "in the future", with the particles already created and moving.
        Parameters:
        time - The start time in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        This.

      • setFadeOut

        public ParticleSystem setFadeOut(long milisecondsBeforeEnd,
                                 Interpolator interpolator)
        Configures a fade-out for the particles when they disappear.
        Parameters:
        milisecondsBeforeEnd - Fade-out duration in milliseconds.
        interpolator - The interpolator for the fade-out (default is linear).
        Returns:
        This.

      • setFadeOut

        public ParticleSystem setFadeOut(long duration)
        Configures a fade-out for the particles when they disappear.
        Parameters:
        duration - Fade-out duration in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        This.

      • emitWithGravity

        public void emitWithGravity(View emitter,
                            int gravity,
                            int particlesPerSecond,
                            int emittingTime)
        Starts emitting particles from a specific view. If at some point the number goes over the amount of particles available on create, no new particles will be created.
        Parameters:
        emitter - View from whose center the particles will be emitted.
        gravity - Which position among the view the emission takes place.
        particlesPerSecond - Number of particles per second that will be emitted (evenly distributed).
        emittingTime - Time the emitter will be emitting particles.

      • emit

        public void emit(View emitter,
                 int particlesPerSecond,
                 int emittingTime)
        Starts emitting particles from a specific view. If at some point the number goes over the amount of particles available on create, no new particles will be created.
        Parameters:
        emitter - View from whose center the particles will be emitted.
        particlesPerSecond - Number of particles per second that will be emitted (evenly distributed).
        emittingTime - Time the emitter will be emitting particles.

      • emit

        public void emit(View emitter,
                 int particlesPerSecond)
        Starts emitting particles from a specific view. If at some point the number goes over the amount of particles available on create, no new particles will be created.
        Parameters:
        emitter - View from whose center the particles will be emitted.
        particlesPerSecond - Number of particles per second that will be emitted (evenly distributed).

      • emitWithGravity

        public void emitWithGravity(View emitter,
                            int gravity,
                            int particlesPerSecond)
        Starts emitting particles from a specific view. If at some point the number goes over the amount of particles available on create, no new particles will be created.
        Parameters:
        emitter - View from whose center the particles will be emitted.
        gravity - Which position among the view the emission takes place.
        particlesPerSecond - Number of particles per second that will be emitted (evenly distributed).

      • emit

        public void emit(int emitterX,
                 int emitterY,
                 int particlesPerSecond,
                 int emittingTime)
        Starts emitting particles from a specific (x,y) location on the screen. If at some point the number goes over the amount of particles available on create, no new particles will be created.
        Parameters:
        emitterX - The x coordinate where the particles will be emitted.
        emitterY - The y coordinate where the particles will be emitted.
        particlesPerSecond - Number of particles per second that will be emitted (evenly distributed).
        emittingTime - Time the emitter will be emitting particles.

      • emit

        public void emit(int emitterX,
                 int emitterY,
                 int particlesPerSecond)
        Starts emitting particles from a specific (x,y) location on the screen. If at some point the number goes over the amount of particles available on create, no new particles will be created.
        Parameters:
        emitterX - The x coordinate where the particles will be emitted.
        emitterY - The y coordinate where the particles will be emitted.
        particlesPerSecond - Number of particles per second that will be emitted (evenly distributed).

      • updateEmitPoint

        public void updateEmitPoint(int emitterX,
                            int emitterY)
        Dynamically updates the point of emission.
        Parameters:
        emitterX - The new x coordinate where the particles will be emitted.
        emitterY - The new y coordinate where the particles will be emitted.

      • updateEmitPoint

        public void updateEmitPoint(View emitter,
                            int gravity)
        Dynamically updates the view from where particles will be emitted using gravity.
        Parameters:
        emitter - The new view from whose center the particles will be emitted.
        gravity - The new position among the view where the emission takes place.

      • oneShot

        public void oneShot(View emitter,
                    int numParticles)
        Launches particles in one shot.
        Parameters:
        emitter - View from whose center the particles will be emitted.
        numParticles - Number of particles launched on the one shot.

      • oneShot

        public void oneShot(View emitter,
                    int numParticles,
                    Interpolator interpolator)
        Launches particles in one shot using a special interpolator.
        Parameters:
        emitter - View from whose center the particles will be emitted.
        numParticles - Number of particles launched on the one shot.
        interpolator - The interpolator for the time.

      • stopEmitting

        public void stopEmitting()
        Stops emitting new particles, but will continue to draw existing ones until their timeToLive is reached. To cancel and stop drawing all particles, use cancel() instead.
        See Also:
        cancel()

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        Cancels the particle system and all its animations. To stop emitting, but continue to animate existing particles until they expire, use stopEmitting() instead.
        See Also:
        stopEmitting()
